app.name: TRIZ
app.subtitle: through dialectical reasoning in 6 phases
examples.0: How can we reduce developer onboarding from 2 weeks to 2 days?
examples.1: How might we make renewable energy storage cost-competitive with fossil fuels?
examples.2: How can distributed teams maintain innovation speed without co-location?
problemInput.label: Describe your problem
problemInput.placeholder: What complex problem are you trying to solve? Be specific about context, constraints, and what you've already tried...
decompose.title: Phase 1: Decompose
decompose.description: The agent breaks your problem into irreducible elements, researches the state of the art, identifies hidden assumptions, and generates alternative framings for you to review.
explore.title: Phase 2: Explore
explore.description: The agent maps the problem space across distant domains, searching for structural analogies, contradictions, and adjacent possibilities.
explore.suggestDomain: Suggest a new domain for analogy...
synthesize.title: Phase 3: Synthesize
synthesize.description: Opposing ideas are being confronted through dialectical reasoning. Claims are forged through thesis, antithesis, and synthesis — each grounded in web-sourced evidence.
validate.title: Phase 4: Validate
validate.description: Each claim faces attempted falsification and novelty checks. Only claims that survive rigorous scrutiny earn their place in the knowledge graph.
crystallize.title: Phase 6: Crystallize
crystallize.description: The investigation is being distilled into a final Knowledge Document — capturing validated claims, the dialectical journey, and actionable insights.
claims.title: Phase 3: Validate Evidence
claims.description: Review each claim's evidence quality. Mark whether the evidence is valid, provide counter-examples if you know of any, note missing factors, or suggest additional evidence sources.
claims.evidenceValid: Evidence is valid and supports the claim
verdicts.title: Phase 4: Render Verdicts
verdicts.description: Decide the fate of each claim. Accept, reject, qualify (true only if...), or merge with another claim.
verdicts.unifiedDescription: Review each claim with its scores and evidence, then decide: accept, reject, qualify, or merge.
build.title: Phase 5: Build Decision (Round {{round}})
build.description: Review the knowledge graph, gaps, and negative knowledge. Decide whether to continue exploring, deep-dive on a claim, resolve the session, or add your own insight.
build.maxRounds: Maximum rounds reached. You can only Resolve or Add Your Own Insight.
graph.title: Knowledge Graph
graph.empty: No nodes in the graph yet.
document.title: Knowledge Document
agent.title: Agent Activity
insight.title: Add Your Own Insight
insight.description: Contribute your own knowledge claim with supporting evidence URLs.
insight.label: Your insight or claim
insight.placeholder: Describe your insight, claim, or hypothesis...
evidence.title: Evidence
transition.toExplore: We've dismantled assumptions. Now we search distant domains for structural patterns nobody has connected to your problem yet.
transition.toSynthesize: The landscape is mapped. Time to confront opposing ideas through dialectic and forge something that transcends both sides.
transition.toValidate: Claims are forged. Now every one faces its toughest critic — what survives attempted destruction is real knowledge.
transition.toBuild: Survivors emerge. Weaving validated claims into a knowledge graph — each node earned its place through dialectical fire.
transition.toCrystallize: The forge is done. Distilling everything into a final Knowledge Document — crystallized knowledge from the dialectical process.
transition.toSynthesizeReturn: Armed with what we learned and what we rejected, a new round of dialectical creation begins.
completion.hero.title: Investigation Complete
completion.graph.title: Knowledge Graph
completion.document.title: Knowledge Document
